titleStmt.title: Against VVilliam Li-Lie (alias) Lillie that most audacious atheisticall rayling Rabsheca, that impious witch or wizzard, and most abhominable sorcerer, or star-gazer of London, and all his odious almanacks, and others. / Written by John Viccars schoolemaster of Christ Hospitall, few dayes before his death, which he had prepared for the Black Munday, turned white since his dissolution.
titleStmt.author: Vicars, John, 1579 or 80-1652.

publicationStmt.date: Printed in the yeare when the astrologers and mountebanks lost their judgments, 29 March, 1652.

notesStmt.note: Verse -- "How vain, how light, how foolish, & how naught,".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
